page.title: 07A LOCAL FARMERS STORY
page.content: The farmer we went to see had been farming all his life and he has been living in this farm for 28 years. He told us in 1935 wheat was 3/6d which is about 18p.You could buy one cow for Â£12.00 in 1937 but if you buy one now it is Â£500. Most of the crops grown around this area are corn barley and wheat. You can tell the difference between different sheep because they have a blue mark on the ear or both ears split.Most farmers feed their animals on grass and hay. The farmer we went to see had four tractors and he uses them to plow and work on the land.Two of the modern machines that are used today are Flat Eight and the Combine Harvester.Most farmers have trouble with vandals. They leave gates open and chase animals around the farm.
